p: The changes in water availability are not evenly spread across the United States with increases in runoff projected under the reference scenario over most of the country, except in the West where runoff in the present period (2005–2014) is large in the North but small in the South (see Figure 3). GHG emission abatement policies, and especially POL4.5, are expected to lessen the decrease in runoff in the South West.
